intro: Flourensia macroligulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flourensia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically showy blooms. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Its botanical structure supports its adaptation to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
